original_definition: 'solid fuel cogeneration boiler' means a solid fuel boiler capable of simultaneously generating heat and electricity;
generated_definition: 'solid fuel cogeneration boiler' means a boiler that generates heat and power from solid fuels, such as wood or coal, using a cogeneration process, with an efficiency of at least 96% for seasonal space heating energy efficiency and emissions of less than 100mg/m3.

Article 2: ‘solid fuel cogeneration boiler’ means asolid fuel boiler capable of simultaneously generating heat and electricity;
‘solid fuel cogeneration boiler’ means a solid fuel boiler capable of simultaneously generating heat and electricity;
Article 9: for solid fuel cogeneration boilers, the useful efficiency at rated heat output, expressed in %;
Forseasonal space heating energy efficiency: 96 % forsolid fuel cogeneration boilers, 90 % for condensing boilers and 84 % for othersolid fuel boilers.
